snippet: Pregnancy rates have decreased among all races, ethnicities and age groups — except for women in their 30s and early 40s.
abstract: Report issued by the National Center for Health Statistics shows a decline since 1990 in pregnancy rates among all races, ethnicities and age groups, except for women in their 30s and early 40s; center's researchers say declining numbers are largely a result of more effective birth control.
lead_paragraph: Pregnancy rates have decreased among all races, ethnicities and age groups — except for women in their 30s and early 40s.

headline.main: Pregnancy Rates Sank Over Last 20 Years
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy Rates Sank Over Last 20 Years
